Best Copier Features for SMBs

June 20, 2025 Marga Enterprises

For small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), having the right office equipment can mean the difference between smooth operations and constant interruptions. Among the most essential tools is the copierâ€”a machine that serves as a printing hub, scanner, email station, and more. But with so many models and specs on the market, how do you choose the one that fits your business needs?

In this article, weâ€™ll walk through the best copier features for SMBs, focusing on what brings real value, improves productivity, and reduces long-term costs.

Why Copier Features Matter for SMBs

Many SMBs make the mistake of either overspending on high-end features they never use or cutting costs and ending up with limited functionality. The right feature set should:

  • Support your current workflow

  • Be scalable as your business grows

  • Offer cost-saving tools (energy, toner, paper)

  • Reduce manual tasks through automation

Choosing wisely gives your team an edge in daily operations without overshooting your budget.

1. All-in-One Functionality

For SMBs, space and efficiency are key. A multifunction copier (MFC) that includes printing, scanning, copying, and faxing helps consolidate multiple machines into one.

Benefits:

  • Saves office space

  • Reduces energy consumption

  • Centralizes document management

If your business needs to digitize contracts or send documents regularly, an MFC is a must-have.

2. Duplex Printing (Automatic Two-Sided Printing)

Duplex printing is one of the best paper-saving features in any copier.

Advantages:

  • Cuts paper usage by up to 50%

  • Reduces bulk for filing

  • Environmentally friendly

Duplexing is especially useful for reports, proposals, and internal documentation.

3. Fast Print and Scan Speeds

Time is money, and slow printers are frustrating for staff. Depending on your business size, consider these benchmarks:

  • 20â€“30 ppm (pages per minute) â€“ Good for small teams

  • 35â€“50 ppm â€“ Better for growing businesses or shared copiers

  • 60+ ppm â€“ Ideal for high-volume environments

Fast scanning is also crucial if your team digitizes documents regularly.

4. Wireless and Mobile Printing

Remote and hybrid work models are common now. A copier with Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and mobile printing capabilities allows your team to:

  • Print from phones or tablets

  • Access documents from cloud services

  • Eliminate the need for local connections

This keeps teams flexible, especially in co-working setups or small office environments.

5. Secure Printing and User Authentication

Data privacy is critical, even for small businesses. Copiers should include basic security features such as:

  • PIN or badge access

  • Secure print release

  • Audit logs for tracking usage

  • Hard drive encryption

These are especially useful for businesses handling customer data or financial records.

ðŸ‘‰ Learn how copier configurations can be tailored with Custom Copier Solutions for SMBs

6. Touchscreen Interface and Ease of Use

Modern copiers now come with touchscreen interfaces that resemble tablets. Benefits include:

  • Easy navigation

  • Fewer errors from users

  • Quick access to features like scan-to-email or cloud storage

Ease of use is key for SMBs with rotating staff or minimal tech support.

7. Toner-Saving and Eco Modes

Copiers that include eco-friendly settings like draft mode, toner saver, or auto-sleep not only help the environment but also reduce costs.

These features help SMBs:

  • Lower consumables usage

  • Cut down on energy bills

  • Reduce environmental footprint

8. Cloud Integration and Scan-to-Email

With the rise of paperless offices, cloud access is a game-changer. Look for copiers that integrate with:

  • Google Drive

  • Dropbox

  • OneDrive

  • Email platforms (e.g., Outlook, Gmail)

This enables direct upload, digital archiving, and team collaborationâ€”all from one device.

9. Customizable User Profiles

Some copiers allow businesses to create individual or team profiles. Each profile can:

  • Limit color printing (to save toner)

  • Set page limits per user

  • Access only specific features

This is perfect for managing access in multi-user environments.

10. Reliable Support and Service Access

Features are important, but so is support. Make sure the copier or provider includes:

  • Access to remote diagnostics

  • On-site service

  • Preventive maintenance

SMBs with lean teams canâ€™t afford downtimeâ€”reliable support is a top feature.

Final Thoughts

Investing in the best copier features for SMBs ensures that your business operations remain smooth, cost-efficient, and future-ready. The key is to match features with your actual business needsâ€”not just the specs on paper.

By focusing on what truly benefits your workflow, you can avoid overspending while equipping your team with a powerful tool that supports growth and efficiency.
